text:
What law will prevent #GUNviolence?

We already have gun laws, a lot of gun laws. California has UBG checks, waiting periods, mag limits, AWB, etc. What new law will stop gun violence?

#GunControlNow #GunControl

tweets.text:
In Canada we’ve had 15 mass shootings
Since 1885. 
We have very tough gun regulations. 

In the US
One mass shooting per day. 

Maybe I’m bias b/c I’m Canadian but isn’t it worth sacrificing a few guns to save thousands of children. 

Who will otherwise be killed, each day.

In 2016, six nations including the U.S. produced half of the world's gun-related deaths while holding less than 10 percent of its population.

The NRA told doctors who view gun violence as a public health issue to "stay in their lane." 

Then doctors started a hashtag group #ThisisOurLane to argue for action to reduce gun violence.
